role.name: End user
role.description: Role authorizing end users to log in, change their passwords and review assigned accounts. Note: This role definition is just an example. It should be tailored for each specific deployment.

authorization.name: gui-self-service-access
authorization.description: Allow access to all self-service operations in GUI.

authorization.name: self-read
authorization.description: Allow to read all the properties of "self" object. I.e. every logged-in user can read object that represent his own identity.

authorization.name: self-shadow-read
authorization.description: Allow to read all the properties of all the shadows that belong to "self" object. I.e. every logged-in user can read all his accounts.

authorization.name: self-persona-read
authorization.description: Allow to read all the personas of currently logged-in user.

authorization.name: self-credentials-request
authorization.description: Allow to modify user's own credentials. Note that this is a request phase authorization. It also requires corresponding execution-phase authorization.

authorization.name: self-shadow-credentials-request
authorization.description: Allow to modify credentials of all users accounts. Note that this is a request phase authorization. It also requires corresponding execution-phase authorization.

authorization.name: read-requestable-roles
authorization.description: Allow to read requestable roles. This allows to search for requestable roles in user interface.

authorization.name: requestable-role-details
authorization.description: Allow to show details of requestable roles in the user interface.

authorization.name: assign-requestable-roles
authorization.description: Allow to assign requestable roles. This allows to request roles in a request-and-approve process. The requestable roles will be displayed in the role request dialog by default. Please note that the roles also need an approval definition to go through the approval process. Otherwise they will be assigned automatically without any approval.

authorization.name: self-execution-modify
authorization.description: Authorization that allows to self-modification of some properties, but only in execution phase. The limitation real limitation of these operations is done in the request phase. E.g. the modification of assignments is controlled in the request phase by using the #assign authorization.

authorization.name: self-shadow-execution-add-modify-delete
authorization.description: Authorization that allows to self-modification of user's accounts, but only in execution phase. The real limitation of these operations is done in the request phase.

authorization.name: assignment-target-get
authorization.description: Authorization that allows to read all the object that are possible assignment targets. We want that to display the targets in the selection windows. Note that this authorization may be too broad for production use. Normally it should be limited to just selected properties such as name and description.

authorization.name: operational-objects-get
authorization.description: Authorization that allows to read all the object that are possible to use for (not only) GUI customizations. E.g there might be lookup tables used for attributes, custom form types defined, etc.

authorization.name: assignment-target-read-case
authorization.description: Authorization that allows to read approval status of cases. This is used to display requests to the end users, especially in the "My Requests" box in user dashboard.

authorization.name: self-owned-task-read
authorization.description: Authorization that allows to see all tasks owned by a currently logged-in user.

authorization.name: self-owned-task-add-execute-changes
authorization.description: Authorization to create a new 'execute changes' task owned by a currently logged-in user. This is needed to execute asynchronous operations from the GUI.
